meanings: (손으로 쥐다) hold (sth in one's hand), take; (꽉) grasp, grip, (literary) clasp; (갑작스레) grab, seize
can make neither head nor tail
be unable to figure it out
(관용)be lazy[slow, sluggish] in one´s work;(be) slow-handed

examples.korean: The ball bounced twice before he could reach it. 발음듣기 공이 두 번 튀고 나서야 그가 공을 잡을 수 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The ball bounced twice before he could reach it. 발음

examples.korean: His reputation is without a blemish. 발음듣기 그의 평판은 흠 잡을 데 없다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: His reputation is without a blemish. 발음

examples.korean: to lay a trap for sb 발음듣기 …을 잡을 덫을 놓다[함정을 꾸미다] Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary

examples.korean: Wait till I get my hands on him! 발음듣기 내가 그를 잡을 때까지 기다려! Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary

examples.korean: He was very polite but effectively he was telling me that I had no chance of getting the job. 발음듣기 그는 아주 정중했지만 사실상은 내가 그 일자리를 잡을 가능성이 전혀 없다는 말을 하고 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
